etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Lady's Monthly Museum. From heel + and + toe

definitions: Any dance in which the heel and toes alternately touch the ground. Also more generally (informal): the action or activity of dancing.
The action or an act of walking, especially at a brisk pace (informal). Also: a type of walk in which the transfer of weight from heel to toe during each step is particularly marked.

With reference to walking: such that the transfer of weight from heel to toe during each step is particularly marked, but the fact that one foot is always in contact with the ground distinguishes it from running.

notes.text: Originally with reference to competitive walking.

definitions: Designating a type of walk in which the transfer of weight from heel to toe during each step is particularly marked, but the fact that one foot is always in contact with the ground distinguishes it from running.

notes.text: Originally with reference to competitive walking, especially in "fair heel and toe".

definitions: Of a dance or dance step: involving the heel and toes alternately touching the ground.

In a motor vehicle: designating a driving technique in which two pedals (usually the brake and accelerator) are worked simultaneously with the heel and toe of one foot in order to maintain speed when cornering, changing to a lower gear, etc. Compare to heel and toe.
